404.title: We can’t find the page you’re looking for.
404.description: Please refresh this page or return home and try again.

privacy.formNode: We only share this information with the volunteer service organization that is matched with you depending on your need. [Privacy policy]({{url}})

signup.title: Welcome back, thank you for confirming your email address.
signup.description: You'll use this email address if you ever need to log back in.

home.intro: We connect healthcare workers to volunteer-powered grocery shopping, childcare and mental health services.

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.bullet1: You make a request for support.
howItWorks.bullet2: We share your request with one of our trusted partner organizations.
howItWorks.bullet3: A volunteer will connect with you to fulfill your request.

faq.answer1: Our focus is on helping anyone working for a NYC medical facility or EMS treating people suffering from COVID-19. Support staff, nurses, and doctors are all encouraged to make requests.
faq.question2: How can I be sure that my request and information stay private?
faq.answer2: We share your data securely on a per-request basis with only the service organization that will fulfill your request. For more details, please see our [Privacy policy]({{url}})
faq.question3: Does Help Supply provide the volunteer services?
faq.answer3: No. We gather requests and then route them to the most appropriate of our partner organizations to provide volunteers to fulfill them. Our current partners include {{mutualAid}}, {{workersNeedChildcare}}, {{nycCovidCare}}, and {{invisibleHands}}.
faq.question4: How long will I have to wait for help?
faq.answer4: Many people are in difficult situations, and the volume of requests is high. Our partners will contact you as soon as they can.
faq.question5: Will you expand to other cities besides NYC?
faq.answer5: We're currently working to expand to other cities. If you are a volunteer service organization and would like to work with us, please let us know at

about.title: What we're doing
about.paragraph1: We quickly and seamlessly connect healthcare workers to the services and support they need to keep up the fight against COVID-19.
about.paragraph2: Healthcare workers have daily needs that are squeezed by the COVID-19 fight; needs like grocery shopping, childcare, pet care and mental health support are a challenge to meet. We've built relationships with trusted partners who have armies of volunteers ready to help and equipped with risk-reduction training and supplies. Launched in NYC, Help Supply is expanding to other hard-hit markets.

who.title: Who we are
who.paragraph1: We're a group of designers, technologists, medical students and community organizers from across the country who heard from the healthcare workers in their networks that they are being overwhelmed by this crisis.
who.paragraph2: Since many of us make digital products and services professionally, we decided to apply those skills to help solve everyday problems for healthcare workers so they can focus on caring for the infected.

partners.title: Our partners
partners.paragraph1: We're partnering with the following aid organizations:
partners.paragraph2: We're looking for more organizations, especially in Detroit and New Orleans. If you're an organization providing aid and want to partner with Help Supply, contact us at

privacy.title: Privacy policy
privacy.description: Our privacy policy is designed to help you understand what information we collect from people submitting requests on our site, why we collect it, and how we use it, as well as how it is protected and transmitted.

generalInformation.title: General information
generalInformation.description: We request some general information from all people submitting requests. We only share this information with the volunteer service organization that is matched with you depending on your need. No other party will have access to this information.

zipCode.title: ZIP code:
zipCode.description: This allows us to confirm that you live or work in an area where our partner organizations can provide service.

workFacility.title: Work facility:
workFacility.description: This allows us to identify the healthcare facilities where people know about our service and are using it, so we can focus our communication efforts on facilities where workers might not yet know about Help Supply.

emailAddress.title: Email address:
emailAddress.description: Email validation allows us to verify your identity when you return to the site to submit a new request or edit or delete a previous request. This saves you the time of having to re-enter all of your contact information with each visit.

contactInformation.title: Contact information:
contactInformation.description: This allows someone from our partner service organization to contact you, confirm they are fulfilling your request, and arrange any needed details.

anythingElse.title: Anything else we should know:
anythingElse.description: Each service request includes a field asking for other relevant information you would like passed on to the volunteer service organization. This is just to provide more relevant and meaningful care based on your individual need.

grocery.title: Grocery-specific information
grocery.description: We request additional information from people submitting requests for groceries.

neighborhood.title: Neighborhood and cross streets:
neighborhood.description: This allows our partner service organization to connect you with a volunteer who can deliver to your location.

additionalContact.title: Additional contact details:
additionalContact.description: This allows you to put us in touch with someone else in your home to coordinate delivery.

childcare.title: Childcare-specific information
childcare.description: We request additional information from people submitting requests for childcare.

neighborhood.title: Neighborhood and cross streets:
neighborhood.description: This allows our partner service organization to connect you with a volunteer who can provide care to children at your location.

details.title: Child details:
details.description: This allows our partner service organization to confirm they can provide age-appropriate care for all children needing care, meet any special needs, and match them to the right childcare provider.

informationSecurity.title: Information security
informationSecurity.paragraph1: All information submitted to our site is encrypted and transmitted to our servers and partners over the industry-standard HTTPS protocol. The information we collect is stored securely and privately in Google Cloud, where it is only accessible by you and Help Supply when we are forwarding requests to partners.
informationSecurity.paragraph2: Once transmitted to our partners, we are no longer in control of your information and refer you to their own privacy policies for more information.

alert.preLink: Your email doesn't look like it's from a healthcare provider. Please
alert.postLink: and try your work email or contact

loading.message: Verifying your credentials (should be a few minutes). You'll be able to edit/add once verified.

confirmation.childcareDescription: Your request has been routed to {{organizationName}}. They will contact you to fulfill your request and typically respond within 24 hours.
confirmation.share: Share Help Supply with a coworker

locationForm.title: What is your ZIP code?
locationForm.description: We are currently only able to serve people in the NYC area. Mental health support is available to users in and around the city, but other services are only available in certain boroughs and neighborhoods.

updateLocationForm.title: Want to update your ZIP code?
updateLocationForm.description: Important: We are currently only able to serve people in the NYC area.

unavailable.title: Sorry, we're not able to offer services in your area yet

sent.title: Thank you
sent.description: We'll let you know when we expand to more locations.

contactForm.title: What's your contact information?
contactForm.description: This will allow us to coordinate the services you request.
contactForm.note: Tell us if you are more comfortable with a non-English language and we'll try to find someone who speaks your language.

paymentForm.description: If your request requires payment (i.e., for groceries), this helps us match you with a volunteer who accepts your preferred payment method.
paymentForm.note: NOTE: If you are experiencing symptoms of COVID-19, please do not pay your volunteer in cash.

form.needsFinances: I will need financial help to pay for this service

grocery.content: We cannot guarantee a quick response. If you are in immediate crisis, please explore these other options in addition to making a Help Supply request.

childcare.content: We cannot guarantee a quick response. If you are in immediate crisis, please explore these other options in addition to making a Help Supply request.

mentalHealth.content: We cannot guarantee a quick response. If you are in crisis, or feel likely to hurt yourself or others, please call 1.888.692.9355 to talk to someone now, or text 'WELL' to 65713.
